terraform.description: MCP server for Terraform Registry operations - browse providers, modules, and documentation

azure.comment: Official Microsoft Azure MCP Server (uses Azure CLI authentication)
azure.description: Provides Azure services context including Storage, Cosmos DB, CLI tools, and resource management. Authenticates using Azure CLI (az login).

microsoft-learn.description: AI assistant with real-time access to official Microsoft documentation and learning resources

notes.testing: All three requested servers have been tested using 'claude mcp add' commands and verified working with 'claude mcp list'. Configuration ready for use.
notes.terraform_server: ✅ Terraform MCP server (terraform-mcp-server v0.13.0) provides access to Terraform Registry operations. Type: stdio. Tested and verified working.
notes.azure_server: ✅ Azure MCP server (@azure/mcp v0.9.6) provides access to Azure services. Type: stdio. Uses Azure CLI authentication (az login required). Tested and verified working without environment variables.
notes.microsoft_learn_server: ✅ Microsoft Learn MCP server (https://learn.microsoft.com/api/mcp) provides real-time access to official Microsoft documentation. Type: HTTP. Tested and verified working.
notes.azure_authentication: The Azure MCP server uses Azure CLI credentials. Ensure you are logged in with 'az login' before using this server. No environment variables required.
notes.local_overrides: Create .mcp.local.json (gitignored) for environment-specific configurations or additional servers.
notes.adding_servers: Use 'claude mcp add' command or manually edit this file. See https://docs.claude.com/en/docs/claude-code/mcp for details.
notes.usage: This file serves as documentation and reference. To actually use these MCP servers with Claude Code, add them to your global MCP configuration (~/.config/claude-code/mcp.json) or use 'claude mcp add' command.
